title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.24| 11-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: That's Krishna's mission and that's the mission of all Krishna's devotees also so it is Krishna only who is the supreme personality of God it who creates maintains and unleads the material world and he remains unaffected
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam, explaining Krishna's role as the creator, maintainer, and destroyer, emphasizing his transcendental nature and the mission to liberate conditioned souls.

segments.key_quote: So if you really want to hear the most attractive personal feature of the absolute truth then you have to hear the most confidential part of the Vedic literature which describes those confidentialities of the Vedas and the personal features of the Vedas confidential pastimes and they are described only by great devotees they discard only by great devotees
segments.summary: This segment discusses the different aspects of the Vedas, contrasting the impersonal Brahman feature with the personal Bhagavan feature, and highlighting that the most confidential pastimes of Krishna are revealed by great devotees.

segments.key_quote: Srimad Bhagavatam especially the confidential parts of his activities are described by the confidential devotee Sukhadeva Goswami so Bhagavatam is special literature
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of Srimad Bhagavatam as a special literature containing confidential knowledge of Krishna's activities, narrated by Sukhadeva Goswami.

segments.key_quote: Krishna the personality of Godhead is completely a spiritual personality no tinge of any materiality in his personality he looks like an ordinary person but he is not an ordinary person
segments.summary: This segment explains the transcendental nature of Krishna, emphasizing that he is a completely spiritual personality, and that his activities (Leela) may appear ordinary but are actually expressions of divine love.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is fully present in that sound Krishna so when you say Krishna Krishna appears in the form the sound and he purifies you if you touch him by your consciousness your consciousness becomes completely surcharged with devotion
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Krishna's spiritual qualities, highlighting that his name is non-different from him and that chanting it purifies one's consciousness, leading to attraction to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: This verse explains krishna is all attractive means he attracts everyone and how does he do so by his unlimited attractive qualities he is a reservoir of all wonderful qualities and each person is attracted by one particular quality of krishna
segments.summary: The lecture concludes by discussing the all-attractive nature of Krishna, explaining that he possesses unlimited qualities that attract different individuals, and that uncovering one's heart leads to attraction to Krishna through bhakti.
